intro: Boerlagiodendron sibuyanense, commonly known as the Sibuyan mountain ash, is a rare evergreen tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant is typically found in montane forest habitats at high elevations. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are an important food source for local wildlife. Due to its limited distribution and habitat threats, it is considered a vulnerable species.
